comment: he is an amazing teacher, very knowledgeable about the topics he covers. he genuinely wants his students to succeed, he gives open note tests and on one test gave up to 20 points extra credit. you do have to study, show up for class, and put in the effort. i am in his class at GA state, he works here too
One of my top five professors! He has great stories and makes every class memorable.

wow. Mr. Shapiro was the BEST  professor ever! He has worked in the field and knows what he's talking about. Everything is open book/note. WHen we found out he wasn't rehired (budget cuts)..gah. that killed me.b/c he's AMAZING. whoever isn't able to take him is MAJORLY missing out.

Professor Shapiro is the best teacher you will ever take! The school did not re-hire him and I literally cried. He is so knowledgeable and just wants his students to learn. He made me passionate for CJ and I am so thankful for that. He will be greatly missed. If you can take him at another school DO IT! It will change your life

He goes well beyond the syllabus in explaining the material. You will learn a lot of things that can only be taught by somebody who has worked in the field for decades (like him) vs somebody with a paper degree reciting boring academic nonsense (most others). TAKE HIM!

He is the best teacher! He is so funny. He is willing to help you with anything. He really wants his students to learn and do well in his class. All his tests are based on the lecture and powerpoints and they are all multiple choice and open note, open book!He knows so much about the subject!! I highly recommend him!

I had Shapiro for Police in America and loved this class. He is entertaining and the class is fun. Lots of funny video clips and discussion. All tests are open note and open book, you have to do 2 ride alongs and then write a paper on them. Easy class, awesome professor. Go to class.. attendance can really affect your grade in this class!

I love this class! His tests are open notes/book and MC. He posts all the powerpoints online by the first class, so students can look ahead! He is available for help, and he encourages questions, even if they seem off topic because he can coralate them to the topic at hand! Easy class, but you still learn lots!

My favorite class at KSU so far! Shapiro is funny and very interesting. His lectures are from ppts that you can print out ahead of time, the tests are MC and open note/book. but you still have to review all the material b4 hand. One paper on a courtroom visit. By far the best teacher!!!

Shapiro is an AWESOME teacher and I would recocmmend his class. Lectures off powerpoints. Open note/book for all tests. MC test. One 4 pg MAX paper about courtroom visits (I didnt even go to the courtroom and got a high A on paper) I am taking him for another CRJU class.  Class is kind of boring but he knows SO much about the subject.

makes class fun and interesting. You will learn a lot in this class. Open notes/book tests. 4 page paper on courtroom visits. Tests are not too bad, but you have to pay attention in class regardless that the tests are open notes and book.
Shapiro is the man. Very helpful, open book tests, wants every student to do well. So far one of the best Profs I've had.  Hope to take more of his classes

Professor Shapiro is my favorite professor - by far. His courses challenge you but you learn a lot & it's fun. I had my favorite group assignments (and I hate group assignments) and out of class activities (which I also though I would hate) in his classes. Just make sure you go to class!

Does a good job. If you attend class and study for the exams you will do fine. The tests are open note open book. However, if you don't study or attend class you will not have enough time to complete the tests. Also, some material will be tested that is not in the book or slides but is discussed in the lecture.

Shapiro is awesome! He makes class so enjoyable and interesting. He's a former defense atty, and he's very knowledgeable. I looked forward to his class every time. Open book/open note tests, but you have to read the book to do well. Court visits that were the highlight of the class and a paper on them. You'll learn ALOT-take him!
